regular_tests.name: codeblock_hilite
regular_tests.expected_output:
Hamlet said:

def speak(self):
    x = 1

regular_tests.name: codeblock_multiline
regular_tests.input:
Hamlet once said
~~~~
def func():
    x = 1

    y = 2

    z = 3
~~~~
And all was good.
regular_tests.expected_output:
Hamlet once said

def func():
    x = 1

    y = 2

    z = 3

And all was good.

regular_tests.name: codeblock_trailing_whitespace
regular_tests.input:
Hamlet once said
~~~~
def func():
    x = 1

    y = 2		

    z = 3       
~~~~
And all was good.
regular_tests.expected_output:
Hamlet once said

def func():
    x = 1

    y = 2

    z = 3

And all was good.

regular_tests.name: hanging_multi_codeblock
regular_tests.expected_output:
Hamlet said:

def speak(self):
    x = 1
# Comment to make this code block longer to test Trac #1162

Then he mentioned y = 4 + x**2 and

def foobar(self):
    return self.baz()

regular_tests.name: fenced_quote
regular_tests.input:
Hamlet said:
~~~ quote
To be or **not** to be.

That is the question
~~~
regular_tests.expected_output:
Hamlet said:

To be or not to be.

That is the question

regular_tests.name: fenced_nested_quote
regular_tests.input:
Hamlet said:
~~~ quote
Polonius said:
> This above all: to thine ownself be true,
And it must follow, as the night the day,
Thou canst not then be false to any man.

What good advice!
~~~
regular_tests.expected_output:
Hamlet said:

Polonius said:

This above all: to thine ownself be true,
And it must follow, as the night the day,
Thou canst not then be false to any man.

What good advice!

regular_tests.name: complexly_nested_quote
regular_tests.input:
I heard about this second hand...
~~~ quote

He said:
~~~ quote
The customer is complaining.

They looked at this code:
``` 
def hello(): print 'hello
```
They would prefer:
~~~
def hello()
  puts 'hello'
end
~~~

Please advise.
~~~

She said:
~~~ quote
Just send them this:
```
echo "hello
"
```
~~~
regular_tests.expected_output:
I heard about this second hand...

He said:

The customer is complaining.

They looked at this code:

def hello(): print 'hello

They would prefer:

def hello()
puts 'hello'
end

Please advise.

She said:
~~~ quote
Just send them this:
```
echo "hello
"
```

xxx xxxx xxxxx:```xx.xxxxxxx(x'^xxxx$', xx.xxxxxxxxx)```

xxxxxxx'x xxxx xxxxxxxxxx ```'xxxx'```, xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx ^ xxx $ xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx x xxxx xx xxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx?
regular_tests.expected_output:
xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx. x xxxx xxxxxxxxxx:

"xxxx xxxx\xxxxx\xxxxxx"

xxx xxxx xxxxx:xx.xxxxxxx(x'^xxxx$', xx.xxxxxxxxx)

xxxxxxx'x xxxx xxxxxxxxxx 'xxxx', xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx ^ xxx $ xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx x xxxx xx xxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx?

regular_tests.name: ulist_standard
regular_tests.input:
Some text with a list:

* One item
* Two items
* Three items
regular_tests.expected_output:
Some text with a list:

  • One item
  • Two items
  • Three items

regular_tests.name: ulist_hanging
regular_tests.input:
Some text with a hanging list:
* One item
* Two items
* Three items
regular_tests.expected_output:
Some text with a hanging list:

  • One item
  • Two items
  • Three items

regular_tests.input:
Plain list

* Alpha

* Beta

Then hang it off:
* Ypsilon
* Zeta

regular_tests.name: ulist_hanging_multi
regular_tests.input:
Plain list
* Alpha
* Beta

And Again:
* A
* B
* C

Once more for feeling:
* Q
* E
* D

  * I am inner nested list second item

    • I am inner nested list second item

regular_tests.input:
* I am outer list
  I am something inside
regular_tests.expected_output:
• I am outer list
    I am something inside

xxxxx #xx:xxxxxxx

xxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxx:
xxxxxx: xxxxxxx

regular_tests.name: ulist_with_inline_code
regular_tests.input:
gonna take a break for a bit--all yours if you want to play around too. what I did:

* install cmake
* git clone zulip desktop
* run `cmake-gui ..` in `c:\zulip\zulip-desktop\msvcbuild`
* hit configure/generate until it generated the msvc project (had to make a fix to some cmake files)
* opened vs2013 
* tried to build
regular_tests.expected_output:
gonna take a break for a bit--all yours if you want to play around too. what I did:

  • install cmake
  • git clone zulip desktop
  • run cmake-gui .. in c:\zulip\zulip-desktop\msvcbuild
  • hit configure/generate until it generated the msvc project (had to make a fix to some cmake files)
  • opened vs2013
  • tried to build
